review: At first I thought it did not work. Even though the initial setup was not difficult, it is confusing that first you need to find the Chromecast device in the the settings of phone, pad or laptop you are using during installation, and change the settings to the device. After it is installed, the device goes back to the last setting router you had and Chromecast does not appear in the available router list.Once installed the TV screen showed "Ready to cast", but the phone, pad and laptop could not see the device in the Chromecast App.  I reset the Chromecast and reinstalled several times, but it still did not work. In further reading troubleshooting, an issue is made about the few compatible routers. I thought that was the issue, since the Technicolor TG582n does not appear in Chromecast's router lists. It was not the problem.Chromecast's list of compatible routers is incomplete, they should add the very common Technicolor to their list. Instructions should make it more of an issue to turn all devices on and off, before worrying about router compatibility.After turning on and off the router a couple of times, the devices could all see the Chromecast and it started working. Easy once it starts to work, but a mystery while you see "Ready to cast" but no device could find it, and the icon necessary to cast did not appear.I found out that even though Netflix and Youtube work well, Ipads and Iphones are NOT able to cast Chrome tabs. Software is not "yet" available. Also you need to install a Chrome extension to be able to cast from a laptop. More support is necessary to make this a better device.

review: I had my Chromecast up and running in just a few minutes and was watching cat videos on YouTube just as quickly (cat videos were a kid-friendly choice to test this with. Also: hilarious). After the initial setup, videos appear on my television almost immediately.I've seen some complaints about this device being light on apps- and I suppose it is. However, I've not found this to be a problem. 99.9% of what I would use this for is available to me. Netflix, Hulu Plus, HBO GO, YouTube, and Pandora. Done. Well worth the 35.00 right there.I've read that there are more apps on the way and I have no doubt that's true. Even as it stands, this is a great device.
